DataElement.preferredName: Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain Without Steroid Therapy Within Integer::7 Day Prior Study Protocol Clinical Treatment Administration Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient's brain metastases are stable without use of steroids for 7 days prior to the start of protocol therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain Without Steroid Therapy Within Integer::7 Day Prior Study Protocol Clinical Treatment Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change._A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas)._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._Treatment with corticosteroid drugs to reduce swelling, pain, and other symptoms of inflammation._On the inside; contained in._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::7_The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._Earlier in time or order._The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis._Actual observation and treatment of disease in patients (including experimental treatment) as distinct from theoretical or experimental work._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stable Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.:A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Concepts.longName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).

Property.preferredName: Without Steroid Therapy Within Integer::7 Day Prior Study Protocol Clinical Treatment Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.:Treatment with corticosteroid drugs to reduce swelling, pain, and other symptoms of inflammation.:On the inside; contained in.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::7:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:Earlier in time or order.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:Actual observation and treatment of disease in patients (including experimental treatment) as distinct from theoretical or experimental work.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
The use of exogenous steroids for the treatment of any disease or disorder.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
Actual observation and treatment of disease in patients (including experimental treatment) as distinct from theoretical or experimental work.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have stable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have stable brain metastases without treatment of steroids for at least 7 days prior to trial treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has previously treated brain metastases, are the brain metastases stable and there is no evidence of new or enlarging brain metastases, and are not using steroids for at least 7 days prior to trial treatment?
